abstract: On Tuesday night — the first Tuesday in months that Fox has not had “American Idol” to lift it to the top of the ratings — “Hell’s Kitchen” did the trick instead.
snippet: On Tuesday night — the first Tuesday in months that Fox has not had “American Idol” to lift it to the top of the ratings — “Hell’s Kitchen” did the trick instead.
lead_paragraph: On Tuesday night — the first Tuesday in months that Fox has not had “American Idol” to lift it to the top of the ratings — “Hell’s Kitchen” did the trick instead, as 9.4 million viewers tuned in to the cooking competition at 9 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates. Although CBS’s “NCIS” repeat earned slightly more total viewers at 8 p.m. (9.7 million), the Fox reality series remained far and away the night’s leader among adults 18 to 49.

headline.main: Even Without ‘Idol,’ Fox Leads the Ratings
